corpus.text: The derivative of a function measures sensitivity to change of the output with respect to the input. Formally: f'(x) = lim[h→0] (f(x+h)-f(x))/h when this limit exists. It represents the slope of the tangent line at any point. Key rules: power rule d/dx[x^n]=nx^(n-1), product rule d/dx[fg]=(f'g+fg'), chain rule d/dx[f(g(x))]=f'(g(x))·g'(x). Applications include velocity (derivative of position), optimization (finding maxima/minima where f'(x)=0), and approximation via linearization.
